headline: FDA Letter Stalls Moderna Flu Filing While Stock Trades Above Targets
summary: FDA issues a Refusal to File letter to Moderna (NasdaqGS:MRNA) for its influenza vaccine candidate mRNA-1010. The decision centers on the choice of clinical trial comparator, not on safety or efficacy concerns. The FDA decline means the current application will not move into full review unless Moderna adjusts and resubmits. Moderna, known for its mRNA based Covid-19 vaccine, has been working to expand into seasonal respiratory vaccines, including flu. The FDA response on mRNA-1010 focuses...

headline: Why Moderna Stock Is Sinking Today
summary: Moderna Stock Drops After FDA Rejects Flu Vaccine Filing

raw.headline: Why Moderna Stock Is Sinking Today
raw.summary: Moderna Stock Drops After FDA Rejects Flu Vaccine Filing

headline: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
summary: 0647 ET – Shares in Moderna fall 8% premarket after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration refused to review the drugmaker’s application to sell a new seasonal flu vaccine.  The FDA said Moderna failed to adequately compare the vaccine to its peers, though it didn’t cite safety or efficacy issues in a letter to the company.  The FDA’s decision could also impact the pending approval of Moderna’s combined Covid-19 and flu jab, in turn weighing on the company’s 2028 cash flow, the analysts say.

raw.headline: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
raw.summary: 0647 ET – Shares in Moderna fall 8% premarket after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration refused to review the drugmaker’s application to sell a new seasonal flu vaccine.  The FDA said Moderna failed to adequately compare the vaccine to its peers, though it didn’t cite safety or efficacy issues in a letter to the company.  The FDA’s decision could also impact the pending approval of Moderna’s combined Covid-19 and flu jab, in turn weighing on the company’s 2028 cash flow, the analysts say.

headline: Ancora to oppose WBD-Netflix deal, Kraft Heinz halts split plans
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including the Wall Street Journal reporting that activist investor Ancora is positioned to oppose a potential deal between Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) and Netfix (NFLX), Kraft Heinz (KHC) putting a pause on its plans to spin-off a segment of the food company, and the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) refusing to review Moderna's (MRNA) new flu vaccine. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
